result.heading: EXT.
location: THE NEW TRAIN STATION, NEW ORLEANS

direction.raw_text: . Your father was there the day it opened... He said a tuba band was playing...Oom-pah-pah... 2   EXT. THE NEW TRAIN STATION, NEW ORLEANS - DAY, 1918         2 And we see a TUBA BAND is playing while a ribbon cutting ceremony is taking place across the steps of the new TRAIN STATION...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oom-pah-pah, oom-pah-pah...The finest clockmaker in all of the South built that clock... 3   INT. CLOCKMAKER'S SHOP, NEW ORLEANS - NIGHT, 1917           3 We see an old French Quarter storefront with an endless array of clocks and watches...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His name was Mr. Gateau. Mr. Cake.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 4   INT. THE HOSPITAL ROOM, NEW ORLEANS - MORNING, PRESENT       4 The slightest of smiles crosses Daisy's lips... saying to herself again... "Mr. Cake..." 5   INT. CLOCKMAKER'S SHOP, NEW ORLEANS - MORNING, PRESENT       5 We see a diminutive man in a frock coat with small, delicate hands, "Mr. Cake," working in his downstairs workshop. More than a few clocks stroke midnight, a handsome Creole Woman comes into the workshop... (CONTINUED) 4. 5   CONTINUED:                                                     5 DAISY'S (V.O.) He was married to a Creole of Evangeline Parish and they had a son. Taking his arm, she helps him up to show him to his bed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did I mention, Mr. Gateau was from birth, absolutely blind. 6   INT. CLOCKMAKER'S SHOP, NEW ORLEANS - NIGHT, 1917              6 ...The clockmaker his fine hands blindly working...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And when their son came of age, like boys will do, he joined the army. They saw him off at the old train station. 7   EXT. OLD TRAIN STATION, NEW ORLEANS - DAY, 1917                7 An old wooden barn of a building. Their son, hugging his parents, getting on a flatbed train crowded with other soldiers, pulling away... Mr. Gateau, blindly waving his hat goodbye to his son...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh how he worked, for months he did nothing but work on the clock for the great train station. 8   INT. WORKSHOP BELOW THE CLOCKMAKER'S HOME - NIGHT, 1918        8 The sound of clocks constant ticking. Mr. Gateau at work...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One day a letter came... Blanche comes into the workshop... a letter in her hand... She reads to her blind husband...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: am sorry to inform you that your son was killed fighting for his country, at the battle of the Marne. In the death of Sgt. Martin Gateau I lose one of my most trusted men. (MORE) (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 8    CONTINUED:                                                     8 BLANCHE DEVEREUX (CONT'D) When I informed members of our company he had fallen, on every face could be seen the mark of sorrow... ...we were in hope the Lord would spare him to return home together... Alas this was not to be. I send along his pants, shirt, cavalry pin, kerchief, and haircomb."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Gateau, done for the night, went up to his bed. Mr. Gateau, blindly feeling his way up the stairs...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And their son came home. 9    EXT. OLD TRAIN STATION, NEW ORLEANS - DAY, 1918                9 We see "Mr. Cake" in his familiar hat, his wife holding his arm, standing among the rows of coffins.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They buried him where the Gateau family had been buried for a hundred and seven years... 10   EXT. NEW ORLEANS CEMETERY - DAY, 1918                          10 An old New Orleans cemetery, vines crawling the sepulchers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Cake went back to work on his clock... laboring to finish... 11   INT. THE CLOCK WORKSHOP, NEW ORLEANS - LATE NIGHT, 1918        11 Mr. Gateau blindly setting the last spring, closing up the clock back... finished at last.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It was a morning to remember... Papa said there were people everywhere... 12   INT. THE NEW TRAIN STATION, NEW ORLEANS - DAY, 1918            12 And we see a large throng gathered to watch the unveiling of the clock. Politicians, citizens, and pickpockets alike... (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 12   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Even Teddy Roosevelt had come. And we see the distinctive figure of Theodore Roosevelt, in overcoat and hat, the war heavy on his shoulders. We watch Mr. Cake, with the aid of an assistant, climbing the scaffolding to his clock covered by a velvet drape... He stands for a moment... and with a simple tug, releases the purple swath... People gasp at the magnificent clock... "Mr. Cake" winds the clock, which chimes a glorious chime... Pushed by an angel, the second-hand begins its eternal journey...going around... Everyone cheers... until they realize the clock is going the wrong way... traveling backwards in time... A man shouts, "It's running backwards!"
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I made it this way... so that perhaps, the boys who were lost in the war might stand and go home again... 13   EXT. BATTLEFIELD - DAY, 1918                                13 And we see just that... bullets leaving mens' wounds sailing back into the rifles from whence they came... limbs, whole again... cannon balls rocketing backwards into the cannons' breech... Fallen come to their feet, to live and breathe again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... home to farm, to work, have children, to live long, full lives... 14   INT. THE NEW TRAIN STATION, NEW ORLEANS - DAY, 1918         14 Teddy Roosevelt, bereft, removes his hat...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Perhaps, my own son might come home again... 15   EXT. OLD TRAIN STATION, NEW ORLEANS - DAY, ANOTHER TIME     15 And we see his own son, Martin, once again full of life hopping backward off the train to land where his journey started... back in the arms of his loving parents...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 16   INT. TRAIN STATION, NEW ORLEANS - DAY, 1918                  16 MONSIEUR GATEAU I'm sorry if I offended anybody. I hope you enjoy my clock. And his wife holding his arm, he makes his way across the terminal and exits... The crowd is motionless. They look to Teddy Roosevelt for guidance... but he simply puts his hat on, and with his guardians, is gone...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr Cake was never seen again. Some say he died of a broken heart. Some say he went to sea... 17   EXT. THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER - AT THE END OF A DAY             17 Mr. Gateau, blindly rowing... away... 18   INT. HOSPITAL ROOM, NEW ORLEANS - MORNING, PRESENT           18 DAISY He just rowed...rowed...away... The wind loudly rattles the window...they turn to look...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you mind if I make myself a call? I've got somebody watching my little boy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, please go call... It's quiet, Caroline sitting on the bed with her dying mother... with the wind knocking at the window... After some moments:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I hope I haven't disappointed you, Mother.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh honey, you could never disappoint me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wished I had more to show for myself. I know you would have liked to have had grandchildren. (MORE) (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 18   CONTINUED:                                                      18 CAROLINE (CONT'D) My life hasn't been all that... normal... As if to say the pieces haven't all fit... trying to articulate it...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm either a step ahead... or a step behind...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's normal?     A hat full of sand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I need my brown suitcase... The envelope...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: An envelope? Caroline doing what she's asked goes over to one of the suitcases by the bed... She opens it... and among the clothes and the keepsakes, there is indeed an old envelope.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This one?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I tried to read it a hundred different times... but I couldn't bring myself...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you mean?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Read it to me. Daisy closes her eyes... Caroline takes out a sheath of papers... It's a journal of some kind written in longhand... Pages have come undone... scraps of paper, even some napkins...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just the sound of your voice... (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 18   CONTINUED: (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's dated "April 4, 1985." It says, "New Orleans." (after a beat) "This is my last will and testament... (which starts to engage her) I don't have much to leave... few possessions, no money really... I will go out of this world the same way I came in, alone and with nothing. (finding herself engaged) All I have is my story... I'm writing it now while I still remember it..." She's interested. She looks over at her mother.    But her mother's eyes are closed...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "My name is Benjamin..." And Caroline's voice becomes a young MAN'S voice...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "Benjamin Button... and I was born under unusual circumstances." 19   EXT. NEW ORLEANS - NIGHT 1918                                19 THERE'S SUDDENLY AN EXPLOSION OF FIREWORKS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The war to end all wars had ended. We see the streets of New Orleans are filled with drunken, singing revelers... cars jamming the cobblestones, people kissing, shouting joyful... Another burst of fireworks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was told it was an especially good night to be born... (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 19   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 20 ...He runs past a solemn Maid and up a long staircase... barging into the MASTER BEDROOM...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 21   INT. MASTER BEDROOM, BUTTON HOUSE - NIGHT 1918                 21 ... where we see a young Woman is lying on a bloody bed, frantically being administered to by a DOCTOR with the help of the small domestic staff... the PRIEST enters...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why are you here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thomas, I'm afraid she's not going to survive... And the Priest bends to say last rites over the pretty young woman... and the maids, bringing bedsheets, futilely start to change her bloody linens...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's enough...! All of you! They move out of the way... and Thomas kneels beside his wife... She's pale white, fear in her soft brown eyes... He takes her hand...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I came as quickly as I could... I'm sorry I took so long, the streets are filled with people... As if to underscore it, fireworks go off...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You are going to be alright, my dearest darling... I will not let anything happen to you...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Promise me, Thomas... And she is interrupted by the sudden CRY OF A BABY.    But Thomas can't take his eyes from his dying wife...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Promise me, he has a place... He doesn't understand... She looks up at him... holds his hand tight... then she slips away... The Doctor listening for her pulse... He covers her... it's quiet... the Priest's murmured incantations... the housemaids crying... (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 21   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She gave her life for me... And for that I am forever grateful... Thomas, still holding her hand, is unable to let go... When we hear again the BABY CRYING... The BABY'S CRY is not quite right... It is not an infant's cry for succor, or a natural cry to exercise its new lungs... It's a deep, haunting cry from some primal soul... They all turn, and the room stills... listening as The BABY continues its mournful WAIL. Only Thomas goes to answer... The Baby in a basket, swaddled in a thick blanket, its face covered with cloth... Thomas goes to lift it, to see his son's face...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Button...! He lifts the cloth anyway... He recoils... for he has seen some kind of horror... He makes the smallest of sounds, a whispered "Ohhhh." And then he suddenly snatches up the swaddled baby -- running with it out of the room... downstairs... outside... 22   EXT. NEW ORLEANS - NIGHT, 1918                              22 ... Thomas, tears on his face, carrying his CRYING BABY, through the streets... Pushing through crowds... 23   EXT. A BRIDGE, NEW ORLEANS - NIGHT, 1918                    23 ... he comes along an old bridge over a waterway... the air heavy with the haze of fireworks... the water dark... brokenhearted, he lifts the baby to throw it into the black water... He is just at the apex of this throw when, despite his sadness, he can't bring himself to do it... Instead, cradles the newborn...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry... I'm so sorry... A LANTERN lights his face... A POLICEMAN down the way...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you doing there!? The BABY starts to CRY...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you have there? Thomas takes off... the Policeman after him... Thomas, carrying the CRYING BABY, running...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 23A   EXT. NEW ORLEANS, GARDEN DISTRICT - NIGHT, 1918             23A Thomas, scuttling with the crying infant through narrow streets past the back porches and the back stairs of the large old moldering antebellum houses... 24    EXT. THE BACK OF AN OLD NEW ORLEANS HOUSE - NIGHT, 1918     24 He comes to an old three-story house with a screened porch, VOICES from inside... PEOPLE TALKING and LAUGHING... The Baby, soothed by the soft yellow light, by the music of the voices, by the house itself -- stops its mournful cry. Thomas stops, catching his breath... He looks in through the back porch... the sounds of VOICES coming... Thomas quietly sets the baby on the back porch steps. He takes out every last dollar he has, tucking the money inside the Baby's blanket... We can just see the figures of two people coming from inside... Thomas knocks on the weathered screen door... And his decision made, he turns, moving away from the house, leaving his child behind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I could've sworn I heard somebody knockin'... When a young Black Woman, in a green dress, comes onto the porch... A thin, attractive woman, in her late 20s, with the sultry eyes of a lounge singer -- She's known as QUEENIE. She's followed by a handsome Black man, MR. WEATHERS -- that everyone calls TIZZY. She looks out the door, and not seeing anything...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I guess not... She stands for a moment taking in the night air...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The air smells sweet... And she sings to herself... a song from the time...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You look very handsome tonight, Ms. Queenie, handsome as I ever seen you... The green matches your eyes...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It isn't everyday a war's over, Mr. Weathers... (MORE) (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 24   CONTINUED:                                                      24 QUEENIE (CONT'D) We have to mark it somehow... You ain't no slouch yourself. He smiles, tips his hat... And they stand in the quiet...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hambert's back in town... came home legless, but he home... we're gonna throw a party for him... help get himself situated... (beat) I know you was sweet on him one time...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sweeter than I shoulda been... Lost his legs you say? "You never know what's comin' for you." And if right on cue an older white Woman sticks her head out...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ms. Simone messed herself...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She got to stop doing that, or it's diapers for her... I'll be right there, Mrs. Jameson... The woman disappears inside.    Queenie, not anxious to go...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It sure is nice out here, Mr. Weathers...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Awful nice, Ms. Queenie... Come out back for a moment... take your mind away from things... He pushes open the porch screen door...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just a moment's time... He offers her his hand... She takes it... He backs out of the house, holding her hand, and he suddenly steps right on top of the Baby... The baby wails, Tizzy stumbles, nearly falls... (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 24   CONTINUED: (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What in God's name...?!!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is that?     A fish crawl out of the river...? She moves to it... pushes aside the blanket, and freezes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: God in heaven! IT IS THE VERY FIRST TIME WE HAVE SEEN THE BABY. What we see is the prominent bald head of any newborn... but it has the face, the wrinkled skin, the faded eyes, of an octogenarian. Indeed, if we didn't know any better, it would seem the newborn was a wrinkled decrepit sad-eyed old man...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My Goodness, the Lord did something here...!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look like a milk wagon run over it... three times... and back... And they're both motionless, not quite sure what to do...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't see it layin' there... I hope I didn't hurt it none... steppin' on it like that... The BABY won't stop its mournful cry...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We best leave it to the police... I'll go -- Queenie hesitates... a longing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's for sure nobody wanted to keep it... And making up her mind, she suddenly grabs up the crying baby, taking it inside... Tizzy, anxiously whispering something, going in after her...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 25   INT. THE NOLAN HOUSE, NEW ORLEANS - NIGHT, 1918              25 A piano's playing a standard, people singing.... There's a myriad of old dark rooms... heavy furniture and carpets... an eclectic mixture of the possessions of those who have lived and died here over many years... and we see a parlor is crowded with Old People, from sixty to ninety-five, in various stages of health... various contraptions to keep them "afloat". An Old Age Home. We see Queenie moving quietly along a hallway, carrying the crying baby so as not to be seen. Tizzy, following her, still anxiously whispering after her...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where are you, Queenie...?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hold your water... (and to Tizzy) Go see to them. He does what she asks. She hurries the baby into a small room, literally like a mouse house, under the stairs... 26   INT. QUEENIE'S ROOM, OLD HOUSE, NEW ORLEANS - NIGHT 1918     26 A small room tucked under the staircase...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Queenie Apple... she went and messed herself all over again...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jane Childress start her a bath... and mind your business, Mrs. Duprey... You'll be messing yourself soon enough too! There's a KNOCK on Queenie's door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Somebody stole my necklace...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll be right with you, Mrs. Hollister... She whispers to The Baby, soothing it. And looking for a place to put it, she opens a dresser drawer... (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 26   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You may be as ugly as an old pot... but you still a child of God...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Queenie, Apple... she won't go take a bath wit'out you...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mercy, I'll be right there. And with that she puts The Baby into the top dresser drawer... with her unmentionables... and shuts it... leaving it open just a crack, enough to breathe... Turning, she sees an Old Woman, looking very lost, looking in the room...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My sister gave those pearls to me... I can't find them anywhere... People are stealing my jewelry...!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They're right here, Mrs. Hollister, right 'round your pretty white neck... (moving her) Come on now... There's a sound of a door chime...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dr. Rose has arrived for his visit... Queenie takes a concerned look back at the Baby, and closes the door... And we stay behind for a moment... inside Queenie's underwear drawer, with the smell of a lilac sachet... is the Baby with the face of an old man... looking up at the sliver of light coming into the dresser drawer... 27   INT. PARLOR, NOLAN HOUSE, NEW ORLEANS - NIGHT, 1918        27 We see the Doctor, an older man in a tired suit, who has done this longer than he cares to remember, finishing examining one of the elderly boarders. He puts his things into his doctor's bag. Queenie comes beside him, saying something...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 28   INT. QUEENIE'S ROOM - THAT NIGHT, 1918                       28 The Baby is lying on Queenie's bed... Dr. Rose, stethoscope ever dangling, washes his hands in a sink.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... He's nearly blind from cataracts... I'm not sure he can hear... His bones indicate severe arthritis... His skin has lost all elasticity... His hands and feet are ossified... He has all the deterioration, the infirmities, not of a newborn, but of a man well in his eighties on the way to his grave...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You mean to say he's dying?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of old age. His body is failing him before his life's begun. They're still, looking at the strange baby.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where did he come from?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's my sister's child... From Lafayette. She had an unfortunate adventure. (whispers) The poor child got the worse of it... came out white...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There are places for 'unwanted' babies like these, Queenie... There's no room for another mouth to feed here... The Nolan Foundation, despite their good intentions, thinks this place is a large nuisance as it is... A baby here -- QUEENIE (appealing) You said he don't have long. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 28   CONTINUED:                                                      28 DOCTOR ROSE Queenie -- some creatures aren't meant to survive. She looks at the Baby, determined.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He is a miracle, that's for certain... just not the kind of miracle one hopes to see... 29   INT. PARLOR, NOLAN HOUSE - THAT NIGHT, 1918                     29 The Old People are sitting around the parlor talking, playing cards... Queenie brings the baby bundle into the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You all listen... And they stop what they are doing...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We have a visitor that will be staying with us for a little while... My sister had a child but couldn't see right by it... He's known as... (a hesitation naming him) Benjamin... (she likes the sound of it) Benjamin... He's not a well child... so we need to take very good care of him... We see Tizzy's come out of the kitchen , watching with an air of strong disapproval... And an OLD WOMAN says...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I had ten children... there's not a baby I can't care for... let me see him... Queenie hesitates, and gives the Baby to her... The Old Woman pushes the blanket back from the baby's face...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: God in heaven, he looks just like my ex-husband... And there's laughter... (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 29   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's prematurely old... Doctor Rose said he don't have much time on this earth...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Join the club. They all laugh. Their laughter makes the baby seem to smile... the lonely smile of an old, dying man. 30   INT. QUEENIE'S ROOM - STILL LATER THAT NIGHT, 1918          30 We see Queenie, unable to sleep, lying in bed, looking out a small window... there's a light KNOCK on the door... Tizzy...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hambert sends his remembrance to you. She nods... The baby cries out... and then it's quiet...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you right out of your mind? I know you don't got all the parts it takes to make one of your own... but this isn't yours to keep... this isn't even human kind... With nothing left to be said, he starts to go...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Weathers. Stay with me tonight. He slows.    She's quiet.     And she whispers:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "You never know what's comin' for you." And as they move to be with one another, to make love; we look over at the dresser drawer -- open just a crack... Benjamin lying among the unmentionables, looking out at the world...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I found a home...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 31   INT. THE HOSPITAL ROOM, NEW ORLEANS - DAY, PRESENT           31 Caroline with the "journal" on her knees. Daisy, eyes closed... the wind gathered in strength... furiously knocking...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is any of this true?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You have such a lovely voice. Caroline shrugs.   She looks through the "book..."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Some pages seem to be torn out here... She discovers inside...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's an old streetcar token. She gives it to her mother, folding her hand around it. But Daisy is somewhere else, looking out the window...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That clock... Just kept going, year after year after year... 32   INT. "NEW" TRAIN STATION, NEW ORLEANS - ANOTHER DAY, 1925    32 And we see "Mr. Cake's" clock with its cherubs pushing the "hands of progress," still marking time backwards... The year is now, "1925..." 33   INT. THE NOLAN HOUSE - DINING ROOM, NEW ORLEANS -            33 EVENING, 1925 BENJAMIN BUTTON'S (V.O.)
direction.name: direction
