result.heading: INT.
location: THE NEW TRAIN STATION, NEW ORLEANS

result.heading: EXT.
location: AT THE END OF A DAY 17

dialogue.raw_text: And for her mother's sake she begins to read it... with no particular interest, like reading to someone a selection from a menu's choices...
dialogue.name: dialogue

result.heading: EXT.
location: NIGHT 1918 19 THERE'S SUDDENLY AN EXPLOSION OF FIREWORKS

dialogue.raw_text: And we see in the fireworks' light, a young MAN in his early 30s, THOMAS BUTTON, running up to the gate of a fashionable town home. He nearly collides with a PRIEST who arrives there at the same time. Thomas runs past him, up the steps... 20   INT. BUTTON HOUSE, NEW ORLEANS - NIGHT 1918
dialogue.name: dialogue

result.heading: IT IS THE VERY FIRST TIME WE HAVE SEEN THE BABY
INT.
location: QUEENIE'S ROOM, OLD HOUSE, NEW ORLEANS

direction.raw_text: ...I didn't know I was a child. I thought I was like everyone else who lived there, an old man, in my "golden years." The boarders eating dinner. Queenie, in a white uniform... along with Tizzy, wearing a chef's hat and apron, helping her serve. We move across the ancient faces... until we come to one particular face... Wearing eyeglasses now... but the same wrinkled face we've come to know... the face of a very old man... (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 33   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stop bangin' that fork... (fixing it in his arthritic hand) It's for eating, not for playin' with... And use your napkin, please Mr. Benjamin... And he does as he's told... A staff member helps one of the old men, feeding him... Benjamin just another old man having dinner with his contemporaries. 34   EXT. THE PORCH, NOLAN HOUSE, NEW ORLEANS - NIGHT, 1925      34 A line of old people in rockers. Benjamin, like any six- year-old, bored, wheels his chair back and forth, between them... until one of the oldsters, who has had enough, sticks his cane in the spokes of his wheelchair, making him come to an abrupt stop... Benjamin, sitting with the other oldsters on the porch... the old people rocking... Sounds drift from the street beyond the wall... children playing... people talking...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's there? Nobody says anything, rocking. Benjamin, eternally curious needing to know, suddenly wheels himself precariously to the very edge of the porch where the wall is lower and he just sees the street... children running on the street, playing... carriages dropping people off for a party... He leans forward to get an even better view... When Queenie suddenly grabs him...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Benjamin! That's dangerous... Come back here...! ...Rolling his wheelchair away from the edge to the safety of the old people... out of sight of the street...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 35   INT. QUEENIE'S ROOM - NIGHT, 1925                            35 The small room with the small window. We see Benjamin in a bed made on the floor... Queenie in her bed...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I loved her very much. She was my mother. And he reaches to hold her hand. She generously takes his hand... And they lay like that holding hands, Queenie in bed, her "son", the "old man" on the floor...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Somedays I feel like I'm different from the day before...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everybody feels different about themselves one way or another. We're all goin' the same way, just taking different roads to get there... You're on your own road, Benjamin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How much longer do I have to live, Mother?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just be thankful you got what you're given. You already here longer than you supposed to be. We see the door quietly open, Tizzy coming in...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Some nights, I would have to sleep alone. He looks at Benjamin, his signal to pick him up, carrying him out of the room, sitting him in his wheelchair, Tizzy going back down into the room to be with Queenie... shutting the door... 36   INT. THE PARLOR, NOLAN HOUSE, LATE AT NIGHT, 1925            36 An Old Woman's fallen fast asleep in an easy chair, a book on her lap. Benjamin sitting alone in his wheelchair, listening to the sounds of the house. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 36   CONTINUED:                                                        36 BENJAMIN BUTTON'S (V.O.) I didn't mind. I would listen to the house breathing. All the people sleeping. I felt safe. Be he still wants to know "What's over there?" He wheels himself over to sit at the window looking outside... looking at the streetlights, the world beyond the gate... trying to see what's dangerous...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It was a place of great routine... Every morning at 5:30, no matter the weather... General Winslow, U.S. Army Retired... raised the flag... 37   EXT. THE FRONT LAWN, NOLAN HOUSE - MORNING, 1925                  37 And we see the very elderly General Winslow, doing just that... raising the flag in a downpour, only... he's naked. And as Queenie comes running across the lawn with a coat for him. There's the sound of SOMEONE SINGING OPERA...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mrs. Sybil Wagner, once a noted opera singer... well, she'd sing, Wagner... 38   INT. MRS. WAGNER'S ROOM, NOLAN HOUSE - MORNING, 1925              38 We see a Victrola playing, Mrs. Wagner in her nightgown at a window singing with the musical accompaniment at the top of her lungs... while, down the hall we see Queenie giving Benjamin a bath... massaging his poor crippled legs...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're gonna put some life into these old sticks for you... get you walkin'...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Breakfast was served promptly at six. 39   INT. THE KITCHEN, NOLAN HOUSE - MORNING, 1925                     39 We see Benjamin in his wheelchair, under Tizzy's tutelage, learning to cook... and simultaneously, to read... (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 39   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How we doin'?    What's that say there?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bis...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Biscuits... and...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Graby...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Think. That's a 'v' not a 'b.' Say it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gravy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now you talkin'! Some staff come in getting platters of food...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How many parts butter we got?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Four...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How many parts flour?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Two...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How much is four and two?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Six. Tizzy smacks the back of his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're a regular addin' machine...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dinner was served promptly at six.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 40   INT. KITCHEN, NOLAN HOUSE - NIGHT, 1925                      40 Tizzy washing dishes...Benjamin working with him... putting away cans... reading from one of the labels...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tomato, brown sugar, salt, myasses... Tizzy swats at him with his dish towel...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "Molasses"... And while washing the dishes...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I learned to read when I was five. My grandfather was a dresser for a famous actor. He'd bring home every play for me to read. (Shakespeare) "Kind keepers of my weak decaying age, Let dying Mortimer here rest himself. Even like a man new haled from the rack. So fare my limbs with long imprisonment. And these gray locks, the pursuivants of death, Nestor-like aged in an age of care, Argue the end of Edmund Mortimer." Benjamin's mouth agape, awed, taken by him, his majesty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You thought I was plain ignorant, didn't you? Benjamin never thought about it...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The actor my grandfather worked for was John Wilkes Booth. He killed Abraham Lincoln. You never know... An old man looks in...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When's dessert...? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 40   CONTINUED:                                                       40 TIZZY When it's served. Now sit your wrinkly butt back down, Mr. Lee.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On Saturday nights I would go to Queenie's church... 41   INT. CHURCH TENT, NEW ORLEANS - A SATURDAY NIGHT, 1926           41 A sweltering shout 'em up Negro gospel tent. Queenie pushes Benjamin in his wheelchair past a line of people looking to be healed, bringing him face to face with a mountain of a PREACHER, pouring sweat and full of fire...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What can I do for you, Sister? And Queenie whispers something to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Her parts are all twisted up inside so she can't have little children... He puts his hand on her stomach...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lord, if you could see clear to forgive this woman her sins so she can bear the fruit of the womb. (and shouts) Out damnable affliction! He presses on her stomach... making Queenie nearly fall over... held up by a "NURSE" in a crisp white uniform. And once she's regained her balance...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And what's this old man's irrediction?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's got the devil on his back... trying to ride him into the grave before his time...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Out, Zebuchar! Out, Beelzebub! (after a beat) How old are you? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 41   CONTINUED:                                                       41 And he says what is only true.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm seven, but I look a lot older.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: God bless you.    He's seven! The congregation laughs...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is a man who has optimism in his heart! Belief in his soul! We are all children in the eyes of God. Now we are going to get you out of that chair... we're gonna have you walk... (his hands on Ben's shoulders) In the name of God's glory, rise up! And Benjamin, doing what he's asked, barely able to, his legs akimbo, stands... The people all applaud...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now God is going to see you the rest of the way... He's going to see this little old man walk without the use of a crutch or a cane...! He's going walk by himself on faith and divine inspiration alone...! We'll show that Devil where to go...! Walk on...! And Benjamin takes two very precarious steps and his poor arthritic legs give out... and he sprawls to the floor... The Aides in white nurse's uniforms move to help, but:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't touch him! (kneeling to Benjamin) Rise up, old man! But Benjamin stays crumpled on the floor... The Preacher comes to his feet, standing like a mountain over him...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rise up like Lazarus! Benjamin still lies on the floor... (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 41   CONTINUED: (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I said rise up!! And Benjamin, slowly but surely, makes his way to his feet...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, and say hallelujah! (Hallelujah!) Now walk, my old friend... Walk on...! And Benjamin, one crippled leg at a time, hobbles across the stage... The people urging him on... a string of "Hallelujahs...!" Queenie comes to join him... urging him...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let the Lord carry you... ... ...The Preacher, walking along with him, more a dance than a walk, shouting the name of the Lord... Queenie and The Preacher walking Benjamin across the stage... Benjamin making it to the other end... to a roar of "Amens"!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now, when I look back on it, it was kind of miraculous... But you know the saying, "...the Lord Giveth and the Lord Taketh away..." ... That mountain of a Preacher... in full exaltation to God...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Praise be to the Lord on the highest...! Suddenly pitches over, flat on his face... Having had a spontaneous coronary... lying center-stage, deader than the proverbial doornail... The crisp uniformed "nurses" running to attend to him, and poor "old" Benjamin haplessly looking around. 42   INT. THE PARLOR ROOM, NOLAN HOUSE - ANOTHER DAY 1926          42 The people are gathered...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There were birthdays... (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 42     CONTINUED:                                                     42 A lit cake is being brought in celebrating General Winslow's birthday. He stares at the cake, unhappily gets up, mutters something... and leaves. The oldsters eye the cake, and without a moment's hesitation, dig in...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mrs. Wagner's window open... and not a sound coming out...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 44 A small funeral at   an old cemetery... And while "DIE VALKYRIE" PLAYS on   her crank VICTROLA, an old man bangs cymbals as a grand   finale to the music... while we see SYBIL WAGNER, laid   to rest to sing in another choir: 45     EXT. THE FRONT PORCH, THE NOLAN HOUSE - DUSK, 1926             45 Benjamin with his wondrous ancient face sitting in his wheelchair with the old people on the porch... watching the sun go down...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And one of them, as if to underscore the point, farts... 46-47A OMIT                                                        46-47A 30. 47B   INT. THE NOLAN HOUSE, KITCHEN - ANOTHER DAY, 1927           47B BENJAMIN BUTTON'S (V.O.) For everyone that died, someone would come to take their place... And we see Benjamin coming into the kitchen... Tizzy busy preparing lunch... Benjamin stops, seeing a tiny African man, his back to us, surrounded by old people standing on the lawn... He hears him telling them...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... My first wife and I are captured by neighbor tribe, cannibals... The old people shrink at the mention...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I escaped across the river...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You escaped cannibals?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My wife, she can't swim, so she eaten.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's Mr. Oti... He's an acquaintance of an acquaintance of mine...he'll be stayin' with us in the staff quarters for awhile...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...Second wife stepped on viper and dies... (jocular) It was bad luck to be married to Mr. Oti. They laugh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am captured with six others by Baschiele tribe. They sell us to a big white man... He instinctively turns and sees Benjamin standing in the window watching him. When Mr. Oti spots him he quickly moves out of the window out of sight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 47C   INT. THE PARLOR, NOLAN HOUSE - ANOTHER TIME, 1927            47C We see Benjamin lying on the floor by the stairs playing with some metal army men... when Mr. Oti's distinctive laugh, his voice, drifts up from under the stairs... Benjamin, getting his canes, goes to look... Mr. Oti, standing under the stairs in an alcove with some of the help, telling them his life story... but it's a completely different tone... a mockery of white people and their insanity...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Big White Man brings us to St. Louis, where they make our village at the 1904 World's Fair... They have us livin' in these little huts like we're livin' in Africa... people behind bars staring at us... we told not to look at them... to just go about our normal lives... what the hell they talkin' about... ? They all laugh...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: At night we're done bein' "savages..." we go over the wall into The Rosebud... we drank and laughed until the sun come up... and then we savages again... They nod enjoying the idea... And as Mr. Oti senses Benjamin's presence, turning... Benjamin retreating on his canes as fast as he can back up the stairs... 47D   INT. DINING ROOM, NOLAN HOUSE - ANOTHER DAY, 1927            47D Benjamin sitting at the dining room table reading an oversized book of "Imaginary Beings..." He senses a presence... and Mr. Oti sits down across from him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I hear you not so old as you looking. You just foolin' everybody. What happen, you get Madjembe? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 47D   CONTINUED:                                                     47D BENJAMIN What's a madjembe?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Worms.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't think so. This is just how I am. Mr. Oti looks out at the street.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You want to get a cold root beer?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's dangerous.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who said that? He gets up ready to go. Benjamin hesitates. He can see Queenie busy leaning out a window banging dust from a rug.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...Come on little man... Despite knowing the consequences he takes up his canes and follows Ngunda outside... 48    OMIT                                                            48 49    EXT. STREET, OUTSIDE NOLAN HOUSE, NEW ORLEANS - DAY, 1927       49 They come outside. Children on the street playing. Seeing Benjamin, they come to a dead stop... staring at the freak from the old people's home, with another freak... Mr. Oti suddenly runs into the street...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hurry... Benjamin tries as best he can to keep up... Mr. Oti darts directly in front of a street car, waving his arms, making it come to an abrupt stop... (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 49    CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...Another white man come to my country and say he want to talk to me... 50    INT. THE STREETCAR, NEW ORLEANS - DAY, 1927                 50 We move along the aisle of a streetcar... the various people...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then I am in the monkey house at "Philadelphia Zoological Park." Three thousand people show up my first day... Benjamin and Ngunda siting in the back of the streetcar behind a moveable metal bar that has "Coloreds" painted on it... Mr. Oti taking a slug from a flask... A group of school children nearby can't take their eyes off the two of them... Mr. Oti takes his wallet out, taking out a folded piece of newspaper, showing it to Benjamin... "Bushman shares cage with park apes."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's it like living in a cage?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It stinks. The monkeys, they do some tricks... I throw spear... I wrestle with Kowali, she is orangutan... They have me file my teeth like a cannibal... He shows him his teeth filed into points like a cannibal...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When I'm not playing with monkeys - - they want me to run to bars in my cage with teeth to scare little children... And he suddenly jumps up and does just that, charging with his teeth bared at the school children... They scream... Mr. Oti, taking his seat again, laughs with Benjamin... 50A   INT. (OR) EXT. THE STREETCAR, NEW ORLEANS - DAY             50A Benjamin, ecstatic, his head out the streetcar window, Mr. Oti holding onto the back of his breeches from falling... Benjamin feeling the wind and the city wash over him...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 51   EXT. THE PERISTYLE, NEW ORLEANS - PARK - END OF DAY, 1927   51 Benjamin and Mr. Oti sitting on a bench at the peristyle of a park. Benjamin takes his first slug of a coca cola, taking too big a hit, the coke pouring out of his nose... Mr. Oti gives him a handkerchief... after he's wiped himself up...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why didn't you go back home?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: War between English and Dutch people had broken up kingdom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What did you do?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I leave zoo. Go here. Go there. Everything okay. But I alone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You were all alone?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You'll see little man, plenty times you be alone. You different like us, it's gonna be that way. But I tell you a little secret I find out. We know we alone. Fat people, skinny people, tall people, white people... they just as alone as us... But they scared shitless... He smiles a knowing smile...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not a thing wrong with being alone... no sir... He looks out...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think about the river I grew up on. It would be good to sit by my river again. He looks at his watch.   He suddenly gets up...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 52   EXT. BOURBON STREET CORNER, NEW ORLEANS - DUSK, 1927         52 Mr. Oti and Benjamin coming along the street, music pouring out... They reach a corner where a tall octoroon woman is waiting. She broadly smiles seeing Mr. Oti.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's my little man. You ready, sugar. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 52   CONTINUED:                                                      52 NGUNDA OTI (smiles, pure Ngunda) Always ready. Always ready. (introduces) Filamena, Mr. Benjamin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a pleasure to meet you, Sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can find your own way home, can't you? Although he's not sure he can... he nods, yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The St. Charles Avenue line to Napoleon... And with that, his arm around Filamena's waist, the two of them laughing, walk off... Benjamin's left standing on the street corner... he looks around to get his bearings... he moves along Bourbon Street... A streetcar comes along, bell clanging, it rushes by him... he watches it go... Clasping his canes, determined, he starts walking... bent over, one cane after the other... making his way along the street... 53   EXT. NOLAN HOUSE, NEW ORLEANS - LATE NIGHT, 1927                53 We see Benjamin coming back to the gate... and we hear:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where in God's name have you been?!! And we see Queenie standing on the porch... She's worried sick... she sees his hands are bleeding from blisters. 54   INT. KITCHEN, QUEENIE'S SINK, NOLAN HOUSE - NIGHT               54 Queenie cleaning his hands...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Like to scare the Holy Hell out of me! I was so worried about you...you take my breath away... (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 54   CONTINUED:                                                      54 BENJAMIN (V.O.) It had been the best day of my life. 55   INT. HOSPITAL ROOM, NEW ORLEANS - MORNING, PRESENT              55 And the "caregiver," Dorothy Baker, comes back in.        She feels Daisy's pulse, straightens her pillow...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How's her breathing... ?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shallow. Dorothy nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They're sayin' it's gonna reach us late in the day... I'm goin' to get my baby and take him to my sister's... they said there's nothin' to worry about here in the hospital...Nurses are right here if you need them...I'll see you in about an hour if that'll be okay...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, that's fine...please... She leaves. It's momentarily quiet, the wind knocking at the window... Daisy, ruminating...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Was there just company?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dorothy had to go home... But Daisy's mind is elsewhere...gesturing for her to keep reading...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Caroline... Caroline looks back at the book.       Daisy closes her eyes...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "On Sundays the families would come and visit...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 56   EXT. THE LAWN, THE NOLAN HOUSE - DAY, 1930                   56 The boarders on the lawn with their loved ones... And we          * see an OLD MAN, walking with the aid of a cane coming out         * of the house onto the lawn... And as he moves through the         * people we see it's Benjamin... He has a single cane,              * standing more upright now, a distinctive shock of white hair, eyebrows... A distinguished looking man in his              * seventies, or, in normal years, a growing twelve-year-old boy...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It was Thanksgiving 1930, I met the person who changed my life forever. A chauffeured car has stopped... A Man is standing in the road, looking at the house through the gates... And we realize it's THOMAS BUTTON... looking for a glimpse of his son... Benjamin instinctively turns, but it's too late, his father's back in the car, being driven away... (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 56   CONTINUED:                                                       56 A WOMAN'S (V.O.) Well, Benjamin...                                        * He turns, an older woman nearby...                                    *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why, good day Mrs. Fuller...                             *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Might I say you are looking                              * strikingly youthful...a single                           * cane, your back as straight as an                        * arrow... what elixir have you been                       * drinking?                                                * He laughs...And there's a voice that cuts through the                 * day...                                                                *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Grandma, look at me...                                   * Benjamin, and Grandma Fuller turn to see a little girl,               * no more than eight, standing on a picnic table top doing              * pirouettes, one after another, for an admiring group of               * old people...she full curtsies, bowing --the way dancers              * do head to chest... then raising her head, laughing...                *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now that was really something...                         * Come on over here, you... This is                        * my granddaughter Daisy... This is                        * Mr... Benjamin, I'm afraid I don't                       * rightly know your last name...                           *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Benjamin is just fine...                                 * * (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 56   CONTINUED: (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: * I would never, the rest of my                 * life, forget those blue eyes...               * And with great dignity -                                *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good people, Supper is soived.                *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . * 57   INT. DINING ROOM, NOLAN HOUSE - THANKSGIVING, 1930           57 The families, along with Ngunda and Filamena, are gathered in the dining room, their heads bowed in prayer. We see Daisy across from Benjamin... The prayer's finished, it's noisy...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We pray to Bembe... the creator of all living things... she retired after all that work...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you know turkeys aren't really birds...?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why do you say that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They're in the pheasant family. They can hardly fly. It's sad don't you think? A bird, that can't fly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I like birds that can't fly. They're easy to eat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have something to tell you all... (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 57   CONTINUED:                                                       57 They're quiet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: While we're giving thanks for God's blessings... I've had a miracle happen. (she touches her stomach) The Lord saw fit to answer my prayers. The people applaud the good news.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What does she mean "answered her prayers?"
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's going to have a baby, silly. That's what my mother said when I was going to have a little brother. He didn't live long though. He didn't breathe right... And we can see Benjamin's heart beginning to break... he looks over, Tizzy, proudly smiling... And as Queenie accepts congratulations... Benjamin's old wrinkled face, watching her... looks like he's going to cry... 58   INT. PARLOR, NOLAN HOUSE - NIGHT, LATER, 1930                    58 We see an ABSTRACT BLACK AND WHITE DRAWING.       And we hear a woman's voice...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is the picture of Old Man Kangaroo at five in the afternoon...                                             * AN OLD FINGER comes in pointing to a drawing. We see                  * Benjamin and Daisy, sitting close together on a sofa, and             * Daisy's grandmother, arm encircling them, is reading to               * them from Rudyard Kipling's "Just So Stories."                        *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can tell it's late, because of                       * the shadow here...                                       * Benjamin and Daisy sitting rapt while she finishes                    * reading to them...                                                    * (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 58   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's the time Old Man Kangaroo got                * his beautiful hind legs just as...                * I hope I'm saying this right...                   * just as Big God Ngog had promised.                * You can see that it's five                        * o'clock, because Big God Ngog's                   * pet tame clock says so.                           * (finishing) Isn't that something?                 * Both Daisy and Benjamin, thrilled, say: "Again. Read it        * again."                                                        *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alright, once more... but                         * afterwards (forgetting Benjamin's                 * age) both of you must promise to                  * go to bed...                                      * They both "I promise..." And as she starts to read all         * over again...                                                  *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . * 59   INT. A ROOM, NOLAN HOUSE - LATE AT NIGHT, 1930                 59 We see Benjamin asleep in bed with one of the Old Men, MR. DAWS. The door opens. And Daisy, in her nightgown, has come inside... she slightly touches Benjamin...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you sleeping? He shakes "no."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on... She moves quickly out of the room and Benjamin gets up, and with the aid of his cane, follows her... 60   INT. BACK STAIRWELL, NOLAN HOUSE - LATE NIGHT, 1930            60 The old house still. Daisy, moving quietly down the stairs. Benjamin, his cane softly thumping the steps, following her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where are we going? She doesn't say anything. She leads him into the DINING ROOM... where we see the wash has been draped, sheets and pillowcases, like ghosts over the dining room table, and a smaller side table, and a buffet...to dry...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Under here... And she ducks under a sheet, beneath the dining table... Benjamin follows her into the "fort..."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nobody knows about this but us. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 60   CONTINUED:                                                      60 They sit... The little girl, and the old man with the maturity of a ten year old boy, enjoying their secret lair... She takes a candle out of the folds of her nightgown... She tries to light it, but doesn't really know how to use matches...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will you light it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not supposed to use matches...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't be chicken... Despite his caution, he lights the candle... the candlelight making it feel more secret...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll tell you a secret then you tell me one... (whispers) I saw mommy kissing another man. Her face was red from it. Benjamin doesn't know what to say.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your turn to tell.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm younger than I look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't seem like an old person... like my grandma... Are you sick?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I heard Tizzy and my mother whisper. They said I was going to die soon. (smiles) But I fooled them so far. Daisy looks at him in the flickering candlelight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You are different than anybody I have ever met. Can I? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 60   CONTINUED: (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you doing under there? Who's idea was this candle? She angrily blows it out... and... to Daisy... taking her by the arm...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's after midnight, you come right out here and get back up to bed...! (and for Benjamin, but saying it to Daisy) You are not to be playing together! Play with people your own age...! (moving her along) Now, you come back to bed, young lady...! You're too young to be wandering around in the night by yourself... (and a last word to Benjamin) You should be ashamed of yourself! And they're gone... Benjamin left sitting along under the sheets. There's a slight sound and he sees Queenie, in her nightgown, standing in the doorway...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You are a different child... a man child. People aren't going to understand how different you are.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's wrong with me, Mother?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: God hasn't said yet. Now, back to bed and behave yourself. He crosses up the back stairs with the aid of his cane, and Mr. Oti, like a spectre, is sitting on one end of the back steps smoking a cigarette, drinking form his flask. He looks at Benjamin as he goes by. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 60   CONTINUED: (3)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You get used to it...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You get back in that bed or I'll cane your old ass! Benjamin turns down the hallway and slips into the bedroom -- 61   INT. BEDROOM, NOLAN HOUSE - LATE NIGHT, 1930                 61 Benjamin climbing back into bed with the Old Man. Turning his back to the old man. And Mr. Daws, unable to sleep...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did I ever tell you I've been struck by lightning seven times. Once, when I was fixing a leak on the roof. And we see just that, the old man on a roof getting blasted.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Once, when I was crossing the road to get the mail... And we see that, the man peacefully crossing a country road to get the mail, getting hit by lightning... But Benjamin just lays there looking out the window... all he can think about... despite everything...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I never forgot her blue eyes... 62   INT. THE HOSPITAL ROOM, NEW ORLEANS - DAY, PRESENT           62 The words linger. Daisy, her extraordinary blue eyes, lying on her death bed... the rattle of the window in the wind...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you alright, Mother? She nods "yes." (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 62   CONTINUED:                                                      62 CAROLINE (CONT'D) This man. He loved you from the first time he saw you. She doesn't say anything.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nobody has ever loved me that way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He crossed out something... and then he's written... "When..."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...When the baby came things were different..." 63   INT. THE KITCHEN, NOLAN HOUSE - NIGHT, 1931                     63 We see Benjamin in his pajamas, quietly coming into the kitchen for something to eat... And he slows, seeing Queenie, taking a moment to herself, sitting at the kitchen table, peacefully breast-feeding her infant... as Benjamin slips back out unseen, closing the door after him... 64   INT. ATTIC, NOLAN HOUSE - NIGHT, 1931                           64 We see Benjamin lying on a small bed in the ATTIC... cluttered with years of accumulated things...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I moved into my own room in the attic... I realized, despite a house filled with people that I loved, I was alone... There's a noise. And we see Ngunda Oti is at the door, a suitcase in hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I come to say goodbye. I'm going away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Going away?   Where? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 64   CONTINUED:                                                        64 NGUNDA OTI I don't figure that out yet. I will send you a postcard when I get to there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What about your friend?   The tall lady?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're not friends anymore. That's what happens with tall people. He starts to go...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Goodbye... And he's gone.   Benjamin gets up going to the window. He looks outside. He can see Mr. Oti come onto the porch. There's a full moon. And as he walks off, his arrogant little walk, suitcase in hand, going out the gate, Benjamin watches him disappear into the night.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I spent a lot of time by myself that year... 65   INT. FRONT ROOM, NOLAN HOUSE - ANOTHER DAY, 1931                  65 Benjamin sitting at a table, an old man to look at but no more than twelve, busy playing with magnets...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Until... We see a refined, genteel OLD WOMAN, wearing a hat and gloves, a suitcase at her feet, flanked by an old DOG, just inside the front door...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm moving in today. And just then Queenie appears, the baby on her hip...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Welcome... we was expecting you... (to Benjamin) Could you show her upstairs? (MORE) (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 65   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She will be staying in Mrs. Rousseau's old room. I'll be right with you with some fresh towels... (frowning) We don't usually let dogs in the house.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's as old as the hills. Blind too. Can hardly get around, he won't be a bother much longer. Benjamin, like any young boy, immediately pets the old dog...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I guess as long as he stays out from underfoot. Benjamin helps her with her bags showing her up the stairs...the old dog dutifully following them...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm Benjamin... The woman starts to tell him her name... but we don't hear it because...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As hard as I try, I can't remember her name. Mrs. Lawson, or Mrs. Hartford, or maybe it was Maple? It's funny how sometimes the people we remember the least, make the greatest impression on us. 66   INT. THE OLDER WOMAN'S ROOM, NOLAN HOUSE - DAY, 1931     66 Benjamin sits petting the dog while the Woman puts her things away...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I remember she wore diamonds... and she always dressed in fine clothing as if she was going out. Although, she never did and nobody would ever come to visit her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 67   INT. NOLAN HOUSE, PARLOR - VISITING DAY, 1931                  67 We see the Woman dressed nicely, sitting in a chair reading a book. She takes a look out the window at the families on the lawn and bends back to her book.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...She taught me how to play the piano... 68   INT. PARLOR, NOLAN HOUSE - ANOTHER NIGHT, 1932                 68 The Woman sitting with Benjamin teaching him how to play piano...playing a classical piece like Chopin...Benjamin trying his hand...sounding pretty bad...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It isn't how well you play, it's how you feel about what you're playing. (whispers) Try this. And she plays a ragtime piece...New Orleans music...music for the other whole part of the soul... Benjamin tries his hand and actually plays it fairly well
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You cannot help but put your entire self into the music. And he plays along with her...a piece he won't soon forget...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There were many changes going on, some you could see... some you couldn't. 69   INT. A BATHROOM, NOLAN HOUSE - NIGHT, 1932                     69 We see Benjamin taking a bath. An he notices a single gray hair floating on the surface...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hair, had started growing, in all sorts of places... And he sees some hair is under his arms... and as he looks downward...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Along with other things... (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 69   CONTINUED:                                                      69 Benjamin, naked, looking at himself in a mirror... like a young teenage boy...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I felt like I could do anything, that I could sprout wings... And as he flexes his muscles, feeling like a man. 70   INT. HOSPITAL ROOM, NEW ORLEANS - DAY, PRESENT                  70 It's started to rain, the wind blowing, splattering rain against the window. Knocking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, darlin', the pain...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll get the nurse... She hurries out of the room. Daisy looks out the window. The maelstrom of wind and rain. Caroline comes back with a Nurse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're not feeling too good? She adjusts the morphine drip.      Daisy lays back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nobody seems to know whether to stay or leave. The roads are filled from New Orleans to Baton Rouge already. I think I'm gonna ride it out. (finishing with the drip) There, that should make things easier. Daisy starts to feel the effects of the drip...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Have you had a chance to say your goodbyes? Caroline nods.    The Nurse nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My father waited four hours for my brother to get here from Boger City. He couldn't go without him. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 70   CONTINUED:                                                     70 She affectionately touches Daisy's cheek.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She seems like a sweet woman. Caroline nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I haven't spent as much time as I would have like with her the last few years. Another NURSE looks in...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You busy? The Nurse quickly   goes out of the room. Caroline sits back down looking   at her mother...Daisy opens her eyes... they look at each   other... Caroline knowing Daisy wants to hear the sound   of her voice...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The next page says... Daisy shuts her eyes... (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 70   CONTINUED: (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...Queenie would let me go with Mr. Daws to Bridge City..To watch the boats go up and down the river... 71   EXT. THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER - DAY, 1932                       71 The busy docks... Men waiting, hoping to find work...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: These were hard times... people were doing anything they could to find work... And we see Benjamin, with Mr. Daws, "the lightning man," sitting on a bench with a line of other old men, "killing time," watching the boats going up and down the River...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did I ever tell you I was struck by lightning seven times? Once, when I was in a field tending to my cows. And we see just that, Mr. Daws, along with a cow of his, being hit by lightning.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My fourt' hand didn't show up... Anybody want to make $2 for a day's work around here... Benjamin turns... And he sees a man in his late 40s with his three man crew, standing on the deck of a TUGBOAT, and old rusted tug built out of charcoal iron... The man, its Captain MIKE... Has a thick Irish accent... For some reason none of the able-bodied men needing work respond...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's wrong, nobody wants to get their hands dirty...! Nobody wants to do an honest days work for an honest day's pay...!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He never pays... He always says he'll have to owe it to you... (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 71   CONTINUED:                                                     71 CAPT. MIKE Are all you afraid of workin' for a livin'? Somebody got to want a job... Benjamin suddenly springs up at the opportunity, waving his arms...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I do...!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You got your sea legs old man?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I do. I think.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's good enough for me! Get your ass on board, we'll sure as hell find out! And as Benjamin gets on the boat, heading out to sea... 72   EXT. TUGBOAT, MISSISSIPPI RIVER, NEW ORLEANS - DAY, 1932       72 And we see Benjamin "learning the ropes..." Helping to tow the freighters, into and out of the River ports... Benjamin in this element, like a boy, his hair blowing, thrilled to be on the boat, thrilled by the adventure... willing to do anything...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was as happy as I could be... I would do anything...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I needs a volunteah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, Captain!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Scrape off this bird shit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Right away, sir...! And he hops to it... Happily scraping off the bird shit... Happy to be doing anything... (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 72   CONTINUED:                                                      72 BENJAMIN BUTTON'S (V.O.) And I actually was going to be paid for something I would have done for free.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll put you on the books... pay you next time around...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His name was Captain Mike Clark... He'd been on boats since he was seven... 73   INT. TUGBOAT WHEELHOUSE - END OF ANOTHER DAY, 1932              73 Mike's a hard drinker, God's last angry man... He's drinking as they go in for the night... Benjamin sitting with him in the wheelhouse... Capt. Mike jawing away...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... What were you born to do, old timer?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I haven't found out yet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You haven't found out yet?! How old are you, Benjamin, seventy somethin' or other?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not as old as I look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tha's a good one..." You older than Hades you creaky old bastard! What the hell you been doing with your life?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a short story...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can you still get it up?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I do every morning. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 73   CONTINUED:                                                         73 CAPT. MIKE The old pole? The hard'n?     Can you still get it up?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I guess.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When was the last time you had a woman, you creaky old bastard...?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Never.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Never!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not that I know of.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You been on this earth for more than seventy years and you never got any?! That's the saddest thing I ever heard in my life. Never?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Never.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, then, hell man, you comin' with me!!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He took me to meet some friends... 74   INT. A CLUB, THE FRENCH QUARTER - NIGHT, 1932                      74 Music playing loud... We see Benjamin and Capt Mike at the bar... Mike, hammered...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You din't say?     What did your father do?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I never met my father. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 74   CONTINUED:                                                      74 CAPT. MIKE You're a lucky bastard! All father's want to do is hold you down!.. Out on my father's boat, working da two-a-days... This littl' fat bastard, "tug Irish," what they calls them. They say the Irish the only one's stupid `nough to work a tug. Them and the Portuguese, as we all know how stupid them Portuguese is. I fin'ly get up the nerves and tell him... "I don't wanta spend da rest of my life on a goddamn tugboat...!" You know what I'm sayin'?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You didn't want to spend the rest of your life on a tugboat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Absolutely, damn right! So you know what my father says? He says "Who the hell you think you are?" "What the hell you think you can do?" I tell him. "Well if you askin' -- I want to be a artist." He laughs. He says, "If God wanted you to be an artist he would made you one." "God wanted you to work a tugboat just like me, and that's what you goin' to do?" "Now, if I ever hear you mention art again, I'll throw you overboard!" Well, I went and I show him... I made myself an artist... And he suddenly takes off his shirt, pulls down his pants... And we see he's covered, from head to toe, with "his artwork," and incredible array of tattoos...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A tattoos artist...! I puts every one on myself! And they look it, upside down sideways and backwards...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You have to skin me alive to take my art away from me now! When I'm dead I'm going to send him my arm! (MORE) (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 74   CONTINUED: (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't let anyone tell you different! You got to do what you meant to do! And I happen to be a god-damned artist!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But you're a tugboat captain. Which stops Captain Mike in mid rant... And he has no answer for... His only response is to glare at Benjamin... A back door opens, a slinky woman coming in...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Captain Mike, we're ready for you and your friend...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's go old timer... Break your cherry... This one's on me... As they go...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And here's you pay for today... Don't ever let anybody tell you Captain Mike didn't give a man what he deserved...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought it was $2 for a day's work...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "you can't put a price on education..." 75   INT. WHORE HOUSE, THE QUARTER, NEW ORLEANS - NIGHT, 1932    75 Captain Mike and Benjamin in a small parlor where girls, both black and white, are sitting around...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It was a night to remember... Captain Mike knows just who he wants and moves off with her... Benjamin left standing, not knowing what to do... None of the women seem to anxious to be with the old man... (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 75    CONTINUED:                                                     75 ONE OF THE WOMEN He gives me the willies...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's not for me, no ways... A thin Girl, maybe 19, of mixed ethnicity, decides to take a chance...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How are you tonight, Grandpa? 76    INT. A ROOM, WHORE HOUSE, FRENCH QUARTER - NIGHT, 1932         76 And we see Benjamin and the girl sitting on a bed... And as she undresses him... First things first... tossing him a wash cloth...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Clean yourself up... He doesn't know what she means.. Taking the wash cloth he goes over to the sink and does what he knows how to do, wash his face...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is that any better? 76A   INT. THE ROOM, WHORE HOUSE, FRENCH QUARTER - NIGHT, 1932       76A She's pushing him down, hiking up her skirt, all business...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's go... Time's a wastin'... She climbs on top of him... And instinct takes over... But Benjamin being just a boy... and this being the first time, his excitement gets the immediate best of him...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ohhh...!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come by anytime... She starts to leave... But Benjamin, who likes this an awful lot...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Again? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 76A   CONTINUED:                                                   76A THE GIRL Again? She looks and sees, sure enough... She climbs back on...the results are virtually the same if a bit longer
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My hat's off to you old timer. She gets up to go...she's made it to the door... when Benjamin says...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Again?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Again? She slows, turns to look... And sure enough... He's as ready as he's ever going to be... As she looks at him, a look bordering on amazement... 77    INT. THE ROOM, WHORE HOUSE, FRENCH QUARTER - NIGHT, 1932      77 THE GIRL What are you, Dick Tracy or something? I've got to rest... And that's just what she's doing... trying to catch her breath...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Again? 78    INT. PARLOR, WHORE HOUSE, THE QUARTER - LATER STILL, 1932     78 And we see Benjamin, at the door, happily smiling...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, thank you... Benjamin, floating on air, hovering, never wants to leave...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Have a nice night... (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 78   CONTINUED:                                                     78 BENJAMIN You'll be here tomorrow?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Every night, but Sunday... And she's finally able to go...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It sure made me understand the value of earning a living... the things it can buy you.. Benjamin turns to leave... we hear footsteps... And we see a man, putting on a raincoat, coming downstairs from one of those other rooms... We see it's Benjamin's father... THOMAS BUTTON... Seeing Benjamin he slows... Benjamin, unaware of who he is, turns and goes out... 79   EXT. STREET, FRENCH QUARTER - LATE AT NIGHT, 1932              79 It's a rainy night. Benjamin, feeling like a million bucks, walks along the street, going home... A chauffeured car pulls alongside him, the window rolled down... And we see Thomas Button in the car...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's awful wet out. Can I offer you a ride somewhere...?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's very kind of you, Sir. He gets into the car. 80   INT. THOMAS' CAR, NEW ORLEANS - LATE AT NIGHT, 1932            80 They drive in awkward silence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My name is Thomas, Thomas Button.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm Benjamin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Benjamin... Yes, Benjamin... It's a pleasure to know you. They shake hands. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 80   CONTINUED:                                                        80 THOMAS BUTTON (CONT'D) Would you like to stop and have a drink, Benjamin? 81   INT. BAR, FRENCH QUARTER - LATE AT NIGHT, 1932                    81 A small old bar. Benjamin and his father sitting in the back... The waiter comes over, deferring to Benjamin's age...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What will it be sir?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll have whatever he's having.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sazerac for both of us...with whiskey instead of brandy... The waiter leaves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't drink do you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a night for firsts...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How is that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've never been to a whore house either.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's an... experience...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It certainly is. (and honestly) I'm not very experienced about a lot of things.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That isn't a bad thing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's a first time for everything. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 81   CONTINUED:                                                      81 THOMAS BUTTON True enough. I don't mean to be rude... but your hands seem awful bent... It must be quite painful?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't really know what I have. I have some form of a disease. I have a lot of catching up to do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What kind of a disease?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was born old. Thomas is quiet.    And for many things...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No need to be. Nothing wrong with old age.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry about your disease.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My mother says we're all born with something...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your mother?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm adopted. Thomas looks at him... They get their drinks... Tap glasses, and drink. Benjamin coughs at the taste... But forces it down... And as they laugh at his discomfort... 82   INT. THE BAR - FRENCH QUARTER - LATER THAT NIGHT, 1932          82 Thomas and Benjamin deep in conversation... and both of them more than a few sheets to the wind... Benjamin, particularly overblown like any first time drunk...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... My wife passed away many years ago... (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 82   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm very sorry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She died in childbirth. And there's a moment when it seems like Thomas might tell him, but despite the alcohol he thinks better of it...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To children.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To mothers and fathers... After some moments:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What line of work are you in, Mr. Button?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Buttons. "Button's Buttons." There isn't a button we don't make. Our biggest competition is B.F. Goodrich and his infernal zippers... The waiter comes over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Would you gentlemen like another?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One more Benjamin?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you'll let me pay for it, Mr. Button... He takes out a little of his hard earned pay... proud of himself...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: The face of Benjamin Button, when he should normally be a six-year-old. He's sitting in a wheelchair now... small, shrunken, hunched with age, legs and hands crippled with arthritis... Eyeglasses are just one addition... a hearing aid... a bulky apparatus of its time, is in one ear... But if we look even closer we can see there are sprouts of hair... wisps of white... what would be the last hair for some... seem to be growing in... As we watch him eat, he uses his fork like a child might, banging it just for the hell of it making noise...
